name: FidoCureÂ®
headline: FidoCureÂ® is the leader in Precision Medicine for Canine Oncology.
description:
Cancer is a genetic disease. We know this from decades of human and veterinary cancer research. Precision medicine and targeted therapies are successfully used to treat humans with cancer. At FidoCureÂ®, we bring this approach to the world of veterinary medicine. 

FidoCureÂ® empowers veterinarians to offer genetic sequencing and targeted therapies to treat dogs with cancer. We are committed to expanding the veterinary oncology toolbox for both diagnostics and therapeutics. 

Our veterinary partners have treated thousands of dogs over the past 30 years and work closely with the growing FidoCureÂ® network of over 143 clinics and 180 forward-thinking veterinary oncologists throughout the US.

Together, we can combat canine cancer!

# AI Driven Precision Medicine Platform for Canine Cancer
## Fighting cancer on both ends of the leash
[ VETERINARIANS  ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/for-veterinarians/>)
[ PET PARENTS  ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/pet-parents/>)
## FidoCure patient results are published and validated
Published April 28, 2023
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/NPJ.png)
#### Analyses of canine cancer mutations and treatment outcomes using real-world clinico-genomics data of 2119 dogs
Despite a growing number of targeted cancer treatments in development each year, few are able to reach cancer patients due to the rate at which evidence is generated from human clinical trials
Published July 6, 2023
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/Nature_journal_logo-removebg-preview-300x60.png)
#### Shared hotspot mutations in oncogenes position dogs as an unparalleled comparative model for precision therapeutics
New approaches to the development of cancer therapeutics are urgently needed to improve the current 89% failure rate of novel drugs in clinical trials, and to improve patient outcomes. Spontaneous cancer in companion animals represents a unique opportunity for investigation of novel therapeutics for human and veterinary use
Published September 21, 2023
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/09/Wiley.jpg)
#### Precision Medicine Tools Offer Veterinarians New Hope for Understanding Hemangiosarcoma
A study from researchers at Tufts University, Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard, and FidoCure by One Health Company demonstrated how a commercially available precision pet health platform can illuminate the complex landscape between genetics and disease outcomes for a common and aggressive cancer that affects millions of dogs.
Published January 10, 2024
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Logos_Elsevier-300x46.webp)
#### Precision Medicine in Veterinary Science
There are many successes of precision medicine implementation in human oncology and it is therefore integrated into human cancer management. It is increasingly integrated into canine cancer management, with early evidence of its success. 
###  FidoCure has sequenced, treated, and collected data from thousands of dogs and developed the  largest proprietary cancer data set in the world.​
###  FidoCure has sequenced, treated, and collected data from thousands of dogs and developed the largest proprietary cancer data set  in the world.​
Clinics using FidoCure
0

## We are transforming canine cancer care through ongoing scientific research and innovation in therapeutic treatments.
[ View All FidoCure Press ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/resources.fidocure.com/press>)
[![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/07/WashPostStacked-2_0-removebg-preview.png)](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.washingtonpost.com/wellness/2023/06/19/dog-cancer-trials-drugs-human-treatment/>)
[Dog cancer research advances pursuit of drugs for humans and canines​](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.washingtonpost.com/wellness/2023/06/19/dog-cancer-trials-drugs-human-treatment/>)
Published June 19, 2023 | Compelling genetic data, increased funding and growing collaborations in the past decade are pushing forward development of cancer drugs for both canines and humans
[![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/06/the-washington-post3353-removebg-preview-e1687444975245.png)](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.washingtonpost.com/wellness/2023/06/19/dog-cancer-trials-drugs-human-treatment/>)
[Dog cancer research advances pursuit of drugs for humans and canines​](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.washingtonpost.com/wellness/2023/06/19/dog-cancer-trials-drugs-human-treatment/>)
Published June 19, 2023 | Compelling genetic data, increased funding and growing collaborations in the past decade are pushing forward development of cancer drugs for both canines and humans
[![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/08/tedx.png)](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=N-NrdC65nog>)
[Can Dogs and AI Fight Cancer? ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.youtube.com/watch?v=N-NrdC65nog>)
This talk by CEO Christina K. Lopes explores how our learnings from transforming canine cancer care can inform how to transform cancer in humans-impacting both sides ofthe leash. 
[ View All FidoCure Press ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/resources.fidocure.com/press>)
### There’s no “one-size-fits-all” treatment for cancer. That’s why FidoCure® uses genomic testing to determine the best course of action for your dog’s cancer therapy – beyond standard chemo and radiation.
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/iStock-506511434-scaled.jpg)
#### FidoCure® Approach: Genetic testing reveals which targeted therapies may work best for your dog
Precision medicine can offer a hopeful prognosis. FidoCure® was created by dog lovers and scientists on a mission to make effective canine cancer treatment accessible. Our process uses genomic testing in conjunction with tumor type to identify possible cancer-causing mutations. From there, we suggest targeted therapy to precisely attack the cancer cells.
[ Get a Genetic Test ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/contact-us/>)
Forrest was diagnosed with splenic cancer and given one month to live.
Through the targeted therapy suggested by FidoCure®, he lived happily for nearly 4 years past his diagnosis.
“Thank you for your support and for opening the door to those four wonderful extra years.”
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/plugins/elementor/assets/images/placeholder.png)
— Grace , CT
[ Get Started ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/contact-us/>)
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/forrest-2.png)
Forrest, Golden Retriever
Hemophagocytic Histiocytic Sarcoma
### Thousands of dogs have benefited from FidoCure's AI driven approach when traditional treatments were limited
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/toulouse-1-300x300.png)
### Toulouse 
“Since starting treatment, Toulouse’s tumors have regressed. FidoCure® brought us hope for Toulouse when we thought we didn’t have any options left.”  — Daniel, FL
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/lizzie-1-300x300.png)
### Lizzie
“Thanks to FidoCure®, Lizzie is 100% active again, eating well, and in remission for 5 months.”  — Kimberley and Francois, CT
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Gracie_Gonzalez_1-300x300.jpg)
### Gracie
“[Our vet] told us about the One Health Company’s precision medicine solution, FidoCure®… Now, exactly two months later, Gracie’s cancer is in remission.”  — The Gonzalez Family, FL
[ Get Started ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/contact-us/>)
### Real-World Evidence Resources + Education
  * [ ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/blog.fidocure.com/fidocure-blog/fava> "Global Impact from the U.S. to Korea at FAVA 2024")
[ Global Impact from the U.S. to Korea at FAVA 2024 ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/blog.fidocure.com/fidocure-blog/fava>)
by [Christina K. Lopes](https://www.fidocure.com/</blog.fidocure.com> "blog.fidocure.com") on October 24, 2024 


#### As Seen On:
[ ![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/logos-1024x276.jpg) ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/resources.fidocure.com/press>)
[ ![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/fc_portal_logo_bw.svg) ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/>)
  * [ How it Works ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/how-it-works/>)
  * [ For Vets ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/for-veterinarians/>)
  * [ Blog ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/blog.fidocure.com/fidocure-blog>)


  * [ FAQ ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/faq/>)
  * [ About Us ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/about-us/>)
  * [ Careers ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/careers/>)


  * [ Contact Us ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/contact-us/>)
  * [ Terms of Service ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/terms-of-service/>)
  * [ Privacy Policy ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/fidocure.com/privacy-policy/>)


[ Instagram ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.instagram.com/fidocure/>) [ Twitter ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/twitter.com/fidocure>) [ Facebook ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.facebook.com/fidocure>) [ Pinterest ](https://www.fidocure.com/<https:/www.pinterest.com/fidocure/>)
DISCLAIMER: All patients are enrolled in FidoCure® by a veterinarian with a valid veterinarian-client-patient relationship (VCPR). We use best efforts to inform the veterinarian on available targeted therapy options for patients. FidoCure® does not prescribe therapy. The targeted therapies that veterinarians may prescribe and order from compounding pharmacies, after receiving genetic test results from FidoCure®, may constitute extra-label uses of those drugs. FidoCure® makes no claims that every patient will have genetic test results that lead to targeted therapy options. FidoCure® makes no claims or guarantees about the effectiveness of the diagnostic and targeted therapy selected by the veterinarian for an individual patient. Like most cancer care approaches, the services provided by FidoCure® are not a guarantee of a cure. FidoCure® is not a pharmacy and does not supply drugs directly. By ordering any medication via one of our pharmacy partners, you agree that the pharmacy, not FidoCure®, is solely responsible and liable for any and all issues relating to the preparation, dispensation and fulfillment of the medication. Access to therapy is subject to the commercially reasonable availability of any medication(s) and/or active pharmaceutical ingredient(s) necessary for the selected therapy.

![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/toulouse-1-300x300.png)
### Toulouse 
“Since starting treatment, Toulouse’s tumors have regressed. FidoCure® brought us hope for Toulouse when we thought we didn’t have any options left.”  — Daniel, FL
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/lizzie-1-300x300.png)
### Lizzie
“Thanks to FidoCure®, Lizzie is 100% active again, eating well, and in remission for 5 months.”  — Kimberley and Francois, CT
![](https://fidocure.com/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/Gracie_Gonzalez_1-300x300.jpg)
### Gracie
“[Our vet] told us about the One Health Company’s precision medicine solution, FidoCure®… Now, exactly two months later, Gracie’s cancer is in remission.”  — The Gonzalez Family, FL

DISCLAIMER: All patients are enrolled in FidoCure® by a veterinarian with a valid veterinarian-client-patient relationship (VCPR). We use best efforts to inform the veterinarian on available targeted therapy options for patients. FidoCure® does not prescribe therapy. The targeted therapies that veterinarians may prescribe and order from compounding pharmacies, after receiving genetic test results from FidoCure®, may constitute extra-label uses of those drugs. FidoCure® makes no claims that every patient will have genetic test results that lead to targeted therapy options. FidoCure® makes no claims or guarantees about the effectiveness of the diagnostic and targeted therapy selected by the veterinarian for an individual patient. Like most cancer care approaches, the services provided by FidoCure® are not a guarantee of a cure. FidoCure® is not a pharmacy and does not supply drugs directly. By ordering any medication via one of our pharmacy partners, you agree that the pharmacy, not FidoCure®, is solely responsible and liable for any and all issues relating to the preparation, dispensation and fulfillment of the medication. Access to therapy is subject to the commercially reasonable availability of any medication(s) and/or active pharmaceutical ingredient(s) necessary for the selected therapy.

generated_description:
FidoCure® is a pioneering company based in Palo Alto, California, driven by the mission to lead the charge in precision medicine for canine oncology. Launching from the core understanding that cancer is a genetic disease, FidoCure® applies the lessons learned from decades of research in human and veterinary cancer therapy to dogs, offering hope where traditional treatment options may fall short.

The company enables veterinarians to administer genetic sequencing and targeted therapies, creating an enhanced toolkit for diagnosing and treating canine cancer. This is particularly impactful as FidoCure® aligns with a reliable community of over 143 clinics and 180 innovative veterinary oncologists across the U.S., who have collectively treated thousands of dogs over the last three decades.

Founded as part of Y Combinator’s Winter 2018 batch, FidoCure® exemplifies how technology can be harnessed to improve veterinary healthcare. With a small but dedicated team of 14 employees, the company's approach is bolstered by the largest proprietary cancer data set in the world, having collected and analyzed clinical-genomic data from thousands of dogs.

A significant aspect of FidoCure®'s promise is its AI-driven methodology, which customizes cancer treatments based on genomic testing. Rather than relying solely on traditional chemotherapy and radiation, FidoCure® offers bespoke therapies that target the specific mutations affecting each dog. This tailored approach has resulted in success stories, with pets experiencing prolonged lives and better quality of life after receiving treatment.

In essence, FidoCure® not only fights canine cancer effectively but also serves as a bridge between veterinary and human oncology, sharing insights that could potentially benefit both. For more information or insights into what they do, you can visit their website at [www.fidocure.com](https://www.fidocure.com/). 

So, if you’re in the veterinary field or a pet parent dealing with the tough reality of canine cancer, FidoCure® is worth a look. They’re not just treating dogs—they’re transforming how we think about and tackle cancer in our furry companions.
